thread.title: Michy Batshuayi lays into West Ham fan who made the mistake of trying to troll him
thread.title_full: Michy Batshuayi lays into West Ham fan who made the mistake of trying to troll him

author: gsweet
title: Michy Batshuayi lays into West Ham fan who made the mistake of trying to troll him
text:
BOSS OF THE BANTER Michy Batshuayi lays into West Ham fan who made the mistake of trying to troll him 
Chelsea striker may not score many goals - but he has more than Simone Zaza and is a dab hand at social media By GEOFF SWEET Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments IT seems that if you try to take on Michy Batshuayi on Twitter, the Chelsea striker will eat you up for breakfast. 
Batshuayi may not have scored many goals for the Blues ‚Äì he has five in all competitions this season ‚Äì but he‚Äôs certainly a dab hand on social media. Social Media 3 Michy Batshuayi‚Ä¶five goals for Chelsea and a dab hand at social media 
In November the ¬£33.2million man signed from Marseille last summer made sure one Twitter user who tried to get under his skin over being Chelsea‚Äôs perennial substitute quickly regretted it. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Chelsea news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
His latest blast saw him destroy a West Ham fan who tried to do something similar. 
It all began with a pretty innocent rendering from the 23-year-old Belgian striker who sent out this non-offensive tweet: Have a good evening everyone, thanks for all the messages and support ‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è 
‚Äî Michy Batshuayi (@mbatshuayi) February 12, 2017 Getty Images Simone Zaza‚Ä¶West Ham misfit Getty Images Batshuay celebrates an FA Cup goal against Brentford 
Harmless enough, you might think. 
But a Hammers fan popped up, comparing the Chelsea man to Simone Zaza , who failed to score for West Ham during his loan spell from Juventus. 
@mbatshuayi Zaza has played more minutes in the league this season than you have, let that sink in Related Stories CREME DE LA PREM Burnley's Sean Dyche and Chelsea's Antonio Conte are best bosses in the Prem, claims Martin Keown going in for the kyl Tottenham to rival Arsenal for 'new Thierry Henry' Kylian Mbappe after Monaco teenager nets hat-trick UN-RAV-ELLED Ravel Morrison was a better player than Paul Pogba while at Man Utd, says former youth teammate Jesse Lingard PRICE IS RIGHT West Ham 'to follow Man United and freeze season ticket prices' after poor first year at London Stadium 'I DON'T KNOW WHAT WILL HAPPEN' Pep admits Sergio Aguero could leave City in summer, and may be benched again tonight Continent-Al Juventus and PSG both believe they can tempt Arsenal into selling rebel star Alexis Sanchez 
Needless to say, this didn‚Äôt go down too well with Batshuayi, whose crisp reply pointed out that he had certainly scored more goals in England than Zaza: @callum11fitzer and I still scored more than him ‚Ä¶ let that sink in üòòüòò good night bro 
‚Äî Michy Batshuayi (@mbatshuayi) February 12, 2017 
So while Batshuayi has yet to set the Premier League alight ‚Äì even when Diego Costa has been missing through suspension or injury, Chelsea boss Antonio Conte has still left him out ‚Äì he‚Äôs certainly got the magic touch on social media. Burnley 1-1 Chelsea : Robbie Brady nets stunning free kick after Pedro opener
